descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course covers data collection and summary, random variables, correlation, regression, probability, sampling, estimation, tests of significance, and two-sample comparisons. Does not require calculus and makes minimal use of formal mathematics. Examples are taken from newspapers and other real-world sources. Familiarity with Microsoft Excel is recommended. The computer is used as a tool to enhance students' ability to analyze and interpret data collected. This course combines classroom lecture and discussion with an online component.

This course combines classroom lecture and discussion with an online component. For the lecture and discussion components, this course is paired with an afternoon session of BLP/COMM ST 360-CN taught by Daniel Moser and will meet on alternate Saturdays: 4/1, 4/15, 4/29, 5/13, 5/27. For the online component, students must have ready access to the Internet. This course is part of the Business Leadership year one cohort. First class attendance is mandatory.
